----
\\
~The elements~, attributes~, attribute types and data types are given names
    that match the names in the ~W~3~C recommendation as closely as allowed by
    a strict typing discipline and the lexical conventions of ~O~'~Caml~:
    * //elements// are implemented as ~O~'~Caml constructors with the same name as
         in the ~W~3~C recommendation~.  ~The domain and codomain are specified as <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|~'a elt>>~,
         where <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|~'a>> is a concrete phantom type build out of polymorphic variants~.
* //attributes// are implemented as ~O~'~Caml constructors with <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|a~_>> prefixed to the
         name~.  ~The name is the same as in the ~W~3~C recommendation~, unless an additional
         prefix is required to disambiguate~:
         ** <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|a~_fs~_rows>> and <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|a~_fs~_cols>> instead of <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|a~_rows>> and <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|a~_cols>> for framesets~,
              because of the different argument types~.


* //attribute types// are implemented as ~O~'~Caml types that all have the same names
         as in the ~W~3~C recommendation~, but are all lowercase~.
* //data types// are also implemented as ~O~'~Caml types that all have the same names
         as in the ~W~3~C recommendation and are again all lowercase~.

\\


    ~Finite sets of alternatives are mapped to polymorphic variants~.\\


    ~The phantom type is always the //most general// required by any ~(supported~)
    version of the standard~.  ~Type discipline is enforced by exporting or not~-exporting
    the corresponding constructor~.\\
\\

<<pre class="ocsforge_color odocwiki_code" id="TYPElinktypes"|<<span class="ocsforge_color_keyword"|type>> <<span class="odocwiki_name"|linktypes>> <<span class="ocsforge_color_delimiter"|~=>> <<span class="odocwiki_type"|\\  [ `Alternate\\  | `Appendix\\  | `Bookmark\\  | `Chapter\\  | `Contents\\  | `Copyright\\  | `Glossary\\  | `Help\\  | `Index\\  | `Next\\  | `Other of string\\  | `Prev\\  | `Section\\  | `Start\\  | `Stylesheet\\  | `Subsection ] list>> >><<div class="odocwiki_info"|~Authors may use the following recognized link types~, listed here with
    their conventional interpretations~. ~A ~Link~Types value refers to a
    space~-separated list of link types~. ~White space characters are not
    permitted within link types~.  ~These link types are case~-insensitive~, i~.e~.~,
    <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|"~Alternate">> has the same meaning as <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|"alternate">>~.\\


    ~User agents~, search engines~, etc~. may interpret these link types in a
    variety of ways~. ~For example~, user agents may provide access to linked
    documents through a navigation bar~.\\


    * <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|`~Alternate>>~:
         ~Designates substitute versions for the document in which the link occurs~.
         ~When used together with the hreflang attribute~, it implies a translated
         version of the document~. ~When used together with the media attribute~,
         it implies a version designed for a different medium ~(or media~)~.
* <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|`~Stylesheet>>~:
         ~Refers to an external style sheet~. ~See the ~Style ~Module for details~.
         ~This is used together with the link type <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|"~Alternate">> for user~-selectable
         alternate style sheets~.
* <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|`~Start>>~:
         ~Refers to the first document in a collection of documents~.
         ~This link type tells search engines which document is considered
         by the author to be the starting point of the collection~.
* <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|`~Next>>~:
         ~Refers to the next document in a linear sequence of documents~.
         ~User agents may choose to pre~-load the "next" document~, to reduce
         the perceived load time~.
* <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|`~Prev>>~:
         ~Refers to the previous document in an ordered series of documents~.
         ~Some user agents also support the synonym "~Previous"~.
* <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|`~Contents>>~:
         ~Refers to a document serving as a table of contents~. ~Some user
         agents also support the synonym ~To~C ~(from "~Table of ~Contents"~)~.
* <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|`~Index>>~:
         ~Refers to a document providing an index for the current document~.
* <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|`~Glossary>>~:
         ~Refers to a document providing a glossary of terms that pertain to
         the current document~.
* <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|`~Copyright>>~:
         ~Refers to a copyright statement for the current document~.
* <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|`~Chapter>>~:
         ~Refers to a document serving as a chapter in a collection of documents~.
* <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|`~Section>>~:
         ~Refers to a document serving as a section in a collection of documents~.
* <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|`~Subsection>>~:
         ~Refers to a document serving as a subsection in a collection of documents~.
* <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|`~Appendix>>~:
         ~Refers to a document serving as an appendix in a collection of documents~.
* <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|`~Help>>~:
         ~Refers to a document offering help ~(more information~, links to other
         sources information~, etc~.~)
* <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|`~Bookmark>>~:
         ~Refers to a bookmark~. ~A bookmark is a link to a key entry point within
         an extended document~. ~The title attribute may be used~, for example~, to
         label the bookmark~. ~Note that several bookmarks may be defined in each
         document~.
* <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|`~Other>>~:
         refers to any other type ~(for example <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|icon>> or <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|shortcut>>~)~.
         

\\
>>
<<pre class="ocsforge_color odocwiki_code" id="TYPEmediadesc"|<<span class="ocsforge_color_keyword"|type>> <<span class="odocwiki_name"|mediadesc>> <<span class="ocsforge_color_delimiter"|~=>> <<span class="odocwiki_type"|\\  [ `All\\  | `Aural\\  | `Braille\\  | `Embossed\\  | `Handheld\\  | `Print\\  | `Projection\\  | `Screen\\  | `Speech\\  | `TTY\\  | `TV ] list>> >><<div class="odocwiki_info"|~The ~Media~Desc attribute is a comma~-separated list of media descriptors~.
    ~The following is a list of recognized media descriptors~:
    * <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|`~Screen>>~:
         ~Intended for non~-paged computer screens~.
* <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|`~T~T~Y>>~:
         ~Intended for media using a fixed~-pitch character grid~, such as
         teletypes~, terminals~, or portable devices with limited display
         capabilities~.
* <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|`~T~V>>~:
         ~Intended for television~-type devices ~(low resolution~, color~,
         limited scrollability~)~.
* <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|`~Projection>>~:
         ~Intended for projectors~.
* <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|`~Handheld>>~:
         ~Intended for handheld devices ~(small screen~, monochrome~,
         bitmapped graphics~, limited bandwidth~)~.
* <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|`~Print>>~:
         ~Intended for paged~, opaque material and for documents viewed
         on screen in print preview mode~.
* <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|`~Braille>>~:
         ~Intended for braille tactile feedback devices~.
* <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|`~Aural>>~:
         ~Intended for speech synthesizers~.
* <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|`~All>>~:
         ~Suitable for all devices~.

\\


    ~Future versions of ~X~H~T~M~L may introduce new values and may allow
    parameterized values~. ~To facilitate the introduction of these
    extensions~, conforming user agents must be able to parse the media
    attribute value as follows~:
    # ~The value is a comma~-separated list of entries~. ~For example~,
         <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|media~="screen~, ~3d~-glasses~, print and resolution ~> ~9~0dpi">>
         is mapped to~: <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|"screen">>~, <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|"~3d~-glasses">>~,
         <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|"print and resolution ~> ~9~0dpi">>~.
# ~Each entry is truncated just before the first character that
         isn~'t a ~U~S ~A~S~C~I~I letter <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|~[a~-z~A~-~Z~]>> ~(~I~S~O ~1~0~6~4~6 hex ~4~1~-~5a~,
         ~6~1~-~7a~)~, digit <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|~[~0~-~9~]>> ~(hex ~3~0~-~3~9~)~, or hyphen~-minus ~(hex ~2d~)~.
         ~In the example~, this gives~: <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|"screen">>~, <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|"~3d~-glasses">>~, <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|"print">>~.
# ~A case~-insensitive match is then made with the set of media
         types defined above~. ~User agents may ignore entries that
         don~'t match~.  ~In the example we are left with <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|"screen">> and
         <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|"print">>~.

\\


    ~Note~. ~Style sheets may include media~-dependent variations within them
    ~(e~.g~.~, the <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|~C~S~S ~@media>> construct~)~. ~In such cases it may be appropriate
    to use <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|"media~=all">>~.\\
>>
<<pre class="ocsforge_color odocwiki_code" id="TYPEmultilength"|<<span class="ocsforge_color_keyword"|type>> <<span class="odocwiki_name"|multilength>> <<span class="ocsforge_color_delimiter"|~=>> <<span class="odocwiki_type"|[ `Percent of int | `Pixels of int | `Relative of int ]>> >><<div class="odocwiki_info"|~The value may be a ~Length or a relative length~. ~A relative length
    has the form <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|"i~*">>~, where <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|"i">> is an integer~. ~When allotting space
    among elements competing for that space~, user agents allot pixel
    and percentage lengths first~, then divide up remaining available
    space among relative lengths~. ~Each relative length receives a
    portion of the available space that is proportional to the integer
    preceding the <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|"~*">>~. ~The value <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|"~*">> is equivalent to <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|"~1~*">>~. ~Thus~, if
    ~6~0 pixels of space are available after the user agent allots pixel
    and percentage space~, and the competing relative lengths are <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|"~1~*">>~,
    <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|"~2~*">>~, and <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|"~3~*">>~, the <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|"~1~*">> will be allotted ~1~0 pixels~, the <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|"~2~*">> will be
    allotted ~2~0 pixels~, and the <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|"~3~*">> will be allotted ~3~0 pixels~.\\
>>
